resources.string:
Mission and Values 
 
 The Pennsylvania State University is a multi-campus, land-grant, public research university that educates students from around the world and supports individuals and communities through integrated programs of teaching, research, and service. 
 
 Our instructional mission includes undergraduate, graduate, professional, continuing, and extension education offered through both resident instruction and distance learning. Our educational programs are enriched by the talent, knowledge, diversity, creativity, and teaching and research acumen of our faculty, students, and staff. 
 
 Our discovery-oriented, collaborative, and interdisciplinary research and scholarship promote human and economic development, global understanding, and advancement in professional practice through the expansion of knowledge and its applications in the natural and applied sciences, social and behavioral sciences, engineering, technology, arts and humanities, and myriad professions. 
 
 As Pennsylvania's land-grant university, we provide unparalleled access to education and public service to support the citizens of the Commonwealth and beyond. We engage in collaborative activities with private sector, educational, and governmental partners worldwide to generate, integrate, apply, and disseminate knowledge that is valuable to society.

Ingredients 
 
 				 • 1 Cup of Strawberries 
 
 				 • 1 cup of raspberries, fresh or frozen 
 
 				 • 1 cup of grapes 
 
 				 • 1 cup of diced apples 
 
 				 • 1 cup of sliced bananas 
 
 				 • 1/2 cup of yogurt (strawberry or vanilla) 
 
 				 • 1/2 cup of cool whip (or whip your own cream) 
 


 
 		 Instructions

 
 				 • Place all prepared fruit in a medium bowl 
 
 				 • Stir in Yogurt and Cool Whip 
 
 				 • Serve immediately or refrigerate before serving 
 


 
 		 Source: 
 
 				 • natashaskitchen.com 
 
 				 • https://natashaskitchen.com/ 
							quick-and-easy-fruit-salad/

Ingredients 
 
 				 • Chicken Breast 
 
 				 • Flour 
 
 				 • Salt 
 
 				 • Garlic powder 
 
 				 • Buttermilk 
 
 				 • Panko Crumbs 
 
 				 • Oil 
 


 
 		 Instructions

 
 				 • Slice chicken breast – cut into even, 
							 bite-sized pieces 
 
 				 • Make the flour mixture – Whisk the flour, 
							 salt, and garlic powder together in a medium 
							 bowl. 
 
 				 • Measure buttermilk and panko – 
							 Pour buttermilk into a separate bowl 
							 and the panko bread crumbs onto 
							 a plate. 
 
 				 • Dredge the chicken – Dip chicken bites into 
							 the flour mixture, followed by the buttermilk 
							 then panko. 
 
 				 • Fry the chicken – Preheat about 1-inch of oil 
							 in a deep frying pan to 350˚F and pop the 
							 coated chicken pieces inside. Fry in small 
							 batches until golden brown. 
 
 				 • Allow the chicken to rest – Remove popcorn 
							 chicken from oil with a slotted spoon and let 
							 it rest on a plate lined with a paper towel to 
							 soak up the excess grease or a wire rack with 
							 paper towels underneath.

 
 
 
 		 Source: 
 
 				 • natashaskitchen.com 
 
 				 • https://natashaskitchen.com/ 
							popcorn-chicken-recipe/

Ingredients 
 
 				 • 1 lb ground beef, 15% fat 
 
 				 • 1 medium onion, finely diced 
 
 				 • 1 tsp salt 
 
 				 • 1/2 tsp ground cumin 
 
 				 • 1/4 tsp black pepper 
 
 				 • 2 garlic cloves, minced 
 
 				 • 1/4 cup water 
 
 				 • 1 tsp granulated sugar 
 
 				 • 12 oz spaghetti, to serve 
 


 
 		 Instructions

 
 				 • Place a pot or dutch oven over medium 
							 heat, add 1 lb ground beef and 
							 sautee, breaking it up with a 
							 spatula until no longer pink 
							 (5 minutes). 
 
 				 • Add chopped onion, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp 
							 cumin, 1/4 tsp pepper, cook until soft then 
							 add garlic and sautee until fragrant. 
 
 				 • Add marinara sauce, 1/4 cup water 
							 and 1 tsp sugar. Partially cover and simmer 
							 meat sauce 20 minutes. Done!

 
 
 
 		 Source: 
 
 				 • natashaskitchen.com 
 
 				 • https://natashaskitchen.com/ 
							spaghetti-meat-sauce-recipe/

resources.string:
Welcome to RecipEats, your number one source for all things recipes.


Founded on April 27th, 2022 by Saeed Abdullah, RecipEats has come a long way from its beginnings of HCDD340 at Penn State University. When RecipEats first started out, his passion for eating food drove him to invest in a humble student's group project. We now serve customers all over the great plains of the tri-state area, and are thrilled to be a part of the movement.


We hope you are as much excited about the future of this application as much as we are.


Sincerely, 
Saeed Abdullah, 
CEO, Jumbo Games Inc.
